title: Blackletter-Type Font Identification
content:
Hello,

I was wondering if anyone could help us out on i.d'ing the masthead, blackletter-type font of this publication. I have no further information on the font, designers etc. Any help or close matches to this font would be greatly appreciated. I am a student who wants to use something similar in a project. (I am especially fond of the capitals, namely, the lovely 'P').

Many Thanks,

Faron G

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [tumblr\_mj3iddJtfc1r9chlco2\_500.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016173200/http:/typophile.com/files/tumblr_mj3iddJtfc1r9chlco2_500.jpg) | 73.47 KB |
author: farong

comments.content: That's quite clearly a beautiful, but custom, design. There are quite a few elaborately ornamented blackletter faces (which look nothing like this one) - google for ornamented blackletter. Incidentally, the newspaper name is called the Nameplate. The masthead is the list, usually, inside, of the newspaper's owners, publishers, editors, and principal staff members. - Herb

Some you may like as alternatives: [Aeronaut](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016173200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/facetype/aeronaut), [Monkeytails](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016173200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/wiescherdesign/monkeytails), [Black Swan](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016173200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bomparte/black-swan), [Morover](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016173200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/morover), [Celebration](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016173200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/rmu/celebration), [Ayres Royal](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016173200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/wiescherdesign/ayres-royal), [Zarlino](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016173200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/lillie/zarlino), [Ardenwood](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016173200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/ardenwood)
